name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning masterwork of honor and injustice in the deep Southâ€”and the heroism of one man in the face of blind and violent hatred.
George Orwell's dystopian novel explores the dangers of totalitarianism and the struggle for individualism in a bleak society dominated by government surveillance and manipulation.

name: The Great Gatsby
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's classic novel capturing the essence of the Jazz Age in America, delving into themes of wealth, love, and the elusive American Dream.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's timeless romantic novel explores societal expectations, love, and the complexities of relationships in 19th-century England.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's influential novel follows the disillusioned teenager Holden Caulfield as he navigates the challenges of adolescence and society's expectations.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's enchanting tale of Bilbo Baggins embarking on a grand adventure to reclaim treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug, set in the magical world of Middle-earth.
